message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CC 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with personalized recommendation systems that rely on text information. It also involves learning representations of text using embedding techniques, which is a common approach in IR. 

The paper could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a framework that combines text embedding with personalized recommendation, which involves learning from data. 

The Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper deals with text data and proposes a method for learning text embeddings. 

The Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category is another possibility as the paper deals with personalized recommendation systems, which is a common application of AI. 

Finally, the Computer Communications (cs.CC) sub-category is a less likely possibility as the paper does not explicitly deal with network protocols or communication technologies, but it does involve learning from sparse data, which is a common challenge in communication systems.
